title: Redesigning Academic Library Online Research Guides: Instructional Design and Accessibility-Centered Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Experience operating academic library services and basic online content creation skills
context.additional_context: A short intensive course for current practitioners to improve the limitations of existing topic-based research guides (e.g., path-guided structures) and deliver pedagogy- and accessibility-driven design methods optimized for mobile environments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the process of designing a theme-based research guide that applies pedagogical principles.
Learners can propose three or more accessibility-centered guide structures suitable for mobile environments.
Learners can apply content organization strategies that enhance user navigation experiences to real-world cases.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
